properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A warm and increasingly humid airmass will continue to dominate the area. Heat warning criteria is expected to be reached through Tuesday. Significantly cooler temperatures will arrive Tuesday night. Please refer to your public forecast for further details. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A warm and increasingly humid airmass will continue into tomorrow. Border line heat warning criteria is expected to be reached again. Hot and humid air can also bring deteriorating air quality and can cause the air quality health index to approach the high risk category. Please refer to your public forecast for further details. ### Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A warm and increasingly humid airmass will continue streaming into the regions from the south. Border line heat warning criteria is expected to be reached again into Monday. A cold front will move through to bring an end to the heat late Monday. Please refer to your public forecast for further details. ### The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Summary:

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. Thunderstorms over central Alberta have the potential to produce severe weather until later tonight. ### Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 9:24 p.m. MDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing strong wind gusts, nickel to ping pong ball size hail and heavy rain. This severe thunderstorm is located 20 km west of Nanton and is moving to the southeast at 20 km/h. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-06-22T06:23:21-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-22T03:25:21-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1078050780.2020

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Smoke is causing poor air quality and reducing visibility. Smoke is expected or occurring. High levels of air pollution are expected tonight and Monday due to smoke from forest fires. Smoke plumes from forest fires in the Manicouagan area could affect neighbouring areas. Air quality could deteriorate should the smoke go down to ground level. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. If your home is not air-conditioned, be sure the house doesn't get too warm when doors and windows are closed to keep out smoke. Exposure to too much heat can also result in illness. People with lung diseases, such as asthma and COPD, can be particularly sensitive to air pollution. They will generally experience more serious health effects at lower levels. Pollution can aggravate their diseases, leading to increased medication use, doctor and emergency room visits, and hospital visits. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2020-06-22T18:05:45-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-22T02:06:45-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2256380261.2020
Area: Manic-5 area, Manic-3 area, Chutes-des-Passes - Pipmuacan Reservoir area, Labrieville area
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Humidex values reaching 39 are expected for the next 2 days. The heat wave will continue into the week. Time span: Monday and Tuesday. Maximum temperatures on Monday 30 to 32 degrees Celsius (Humidex 35 to 39). Minimum Temperatures Monday Night: 15 to 19 degrees Celsius. Maximum temperatures on Tuesday 30 to 32 degrees Celsius (Humidex 35 to 39). Locations: New Brunswick except along the Fundy Coast. Remarks: Hot and humid conditions will redevelop Monday and continue through Tuesday for most of New Brunswick. The Fundy coast, however, should cool tonight and stay below warning criteria for the remainder of the week. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-22T16:45:06-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-22T00:46:06-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2898570393.2020

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Another heat wave with begin for the Annapolis Valley on Monday. Time span: Monday and Tuesday. Maximum temperature Monday: 29 degrees Celsius (Humidex 37). Minimum temperatures Monday night: 18 Celsius. Maximum Temperature Tuesday: 30 degrees Celsius (Humidex 35). Locations: Annapolis Valley. Remarks: Another run of very warm days is on it's way. However, temperatures tonight will cool to below heat warning criteria and provide some relief for the overnight hours before very warm temperature return on Monday. ### Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Information is provided on the Nova Scotia Department of Health and Wellness website at https://novascotia.ca/heat-related-illness/. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-22T17:00:22-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-22T01:01:22-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1624028052.2020
Area: Kings County, Annapolis County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, continues. A frontal system has remained stationary over central Yukon giving rain heavy at times to Dawson. Near 25 mm of rain has been recorded since this morning. Another 25 mm is possible before the rain tapers off early Monday morning. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-22T18:32:35-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-22T02:33:35-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2850367010.2020
Area: Dawson
